name: Lahmacun
description: Often dubbed 'Turkish Pizza,' Lahmacun is a round, thin piece of dough topped with minced meat (most commonly beef or lamb), vegetables, herbs, and spices, baked until crispy.
steps: Prepare the dough from flour, water, yeast, and salt. Let it rise for an hour.
Mix minced meat with finely chopped bell peppers, tomatoes, onions, parsley, and spices.
Roll out the dough into thin circles and spread the meat mixture thinly on top.
Bake in a very hot oven until the edges are crisp and browned, about 5 minutes.
Serve hot, rolled up with a squeeze of lemon and optional garnishes like lettuce and sliced tomatoes.
tips: The dough should be rolled out as thinly as possible for the right crispiness.
Do not overload the topping to keep Lahmacun crispy.
Adjust the amount of spices according to taste.
